frame.name: Reason
frame.definition:
<def-root>A volitional <fen>Agent</fen> is responding to a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> by performing some <fen>Action</fen>.
<ex>And <m>was</m> <fex name="State_of_affairs">that</fex> <fex name="Agent">your</fex> <t>reason</t> <fex name="Action">for becoming an actor</fex> ?</ex> <ex>But <fex name="State_of_affairs">Giles</fex> <m>is</m> the <t>reason</t> <fex name="Action">that I am here</fex> .</ex> <ex>Oh <fex name="Agent">my</fex> <t>reason</t> <fex name="Action">for including it</fex> <m>was</m> <fex name="State_of_affairs">Section fifty four A</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person who responds to a <fen>State_of_Affairs</fen> by performing some <fen>Action</fen>.
<ex>Those are <fex name="Agent">my</fex> <t>reasons</t> , " said Toby . </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Action
FE.definition:
<def-root>The action that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs in response to a <fen>State_of_Affairs</fen>.
<ex> I find that all my <t>reasons</t> <fex name="Action">for postponing giving birth</fex> still apply </ex></def-root>

FE.name: State_of_affairs
FE.definition:
<def-root>The eventuality that motivates the <fen>Agent</fen>"s performing a particular <fen>Action</fen> in response to it.
<ex> My <t>reason</t> <m>is</m> <fex name="State_of_affairs">that our cities are now designed round the motor car</fex></ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: motive.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a factor inducing a person to act in a particular way

lexUnit.name: basis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the underlying support for an idea, argument, or process.
